Review Title: As simple and straightforward as it gets
Review Text:
I‚Äôve used Splid now for over a year on different trips away. Some abroad, some at home and a mixture of just two people or up to five. 
It‚Äôs been a lifesaver; no more faffing around trying to figure out who owes what, who‚Äôs down after getting a meal or paying for that boat trip. 
What it does it does very well and I‚Äôd recommend anyone needing to keep a tally on expenses to give it a try. 
Simple interface, you can add a nice trip picture for the event or holiday and as long as someone remembers to add an expense, it gets added into the mix of outgoings. 
What becomes obvious is that when you‚Äôre all using Splid to keep track of your holiday expenses, it really doesn‚Äôt matter who gets the next round drinks, or the meal or the excursion, as it all gets worked out in the end. 
I love it, and will continue to use this for the long term. Kudos to the creator Nico.

Splid is a game-changer for anyone who frequently finds themselves splitting bills with friends, family, or colleagues. Whether you‚Äôre on a group trip, dining out, or sharing expenses with roommates, this app makes the process effortless and fair.

**User-Friendly Interface**  
The first thing you‚Äôll notice about Splid is its clean and intuitive interface. It‚Äôs incredibly easy to set up a group, add expenses, and assign them to the relevant people. Even if you‚Äôre not tech-savvy, you‚Äôll find navigating through the app a breeze.

**Flexible Expense Tracking**  
Splid allows you to split bills in multiple ways‚Äîequally, by percentage, or custom amounts‚Äîcatering to different group dynamics. You can add notes to each expense, which is great for remembering specific details. The app supports multiple currencies, making it ideal for international trips.

**Offline Functionality**  
One of Splid's standout features is its ability to work offline. You don‚Äôt need a constant internet connection to manage your expenses, which is perfect when you‚Äôre traveling or in areas with poor connectivity. Once you‚Äôre back online, the app syncs everything automatically.

**Seamless Settlement Process**  
When it‚Äôs time to settle up, Splid provides a clear breakdown of who owes whom, simplifying the payment process. You can also export the summary as a PDF or Excel file, making it easy to keep records or share with your group.

**No Sign-Up Required**  
Another major plus is that Splid doesn‚Äôt require users to sign up for an account, which is a refreshing change from most apps. You can start using it right away without worrying about privacy concerns.

**Conclusion**  
Splid is hands down the best bill-splitting app available on the App Store. Its combination of user-friendly design, flexibility, and offline functionality makes it a must-have tool for anyone who regularly shares expenses. If you‚Äôre tired of the hassle and awkwardness of splitting bills, Splid is the solution you‚Äôve been looking for. Highly recommended!

We spent two weeks in Italy, sharing meals, taxi‚Äôs, hotels and drinks in numerous places. Splid made our payments so convenient and quick. Review Title: Loved this app - used it on a recent girls trip
Review Text: This app is easy to use and very helpful - used this app on a recent girls trip.   For example, when I tipped the tour guide - I was able to add that tip immediately to the this app then everyone on the group saw the charge and their portion immediately.   Yes, we could all manually track group expenses then figured out who owes what to whom but This app is easy to use, all expenses are visible to the entire group at anytime then easy to settle up.   I highly recommend to use this app for any group travel!!!  By using this app, it‚Äôs much easier to enjoy the trip and not worry about group expenses!!!

My girlfriend and I split expenses, but I usually pay for things at the time of purchase. I enter those purchases into Splid. She‚Äôll forward funds to me periodically via Venmo, and enter it into this app. This has worked perfectly for our needs, and I really like that expenses can be split in ways other than 50/50. It‚Äôs quick and easy to use. We know where we stand at any point in time. I tried another app before this that did not meet our needs because the options weren‚Äôt as robust. I highly recommend this app.

Review Title: Most helpful group travel item ever!
Review Text: My siblings and I just took our octogenarian parents and their friend on a trip to Europe.  We‚Äôve done this several times in the past and the accounting has seemed like a full time job for one or two of us.  This time we discovered Splid!  It saved us so much work and headache! Everyone felt confident that the expenses came out right.  That was important since we are all on a budget but wanted to do this for our parents.  It was easy to learn too.  So awesome! Thank you.

With a couple tweaks, it would be amazing. I do have the paid version but some features I‚Äôd like to see:

Saving tax rates - like I have a different grocery and a general sales tax. I‚Äôd like to be able to select taxes instead of having to calculate them myself outside of the app and then adding the expense. Sometimes I need to add multiple items and THEN do the tax rate per item (some being general, some being grocery.) But there is zero option for taxes. With that, maybe also a tip line for restaurants?

Also the ability to mass select and delete or categorize things would be excellent. Sometimes i forget to add categories when adding an expense and being able to do
So for multiple expenses at the same time would be excellent.

Otherwise - the app is the easiest and most user friendly budget app I‚Äôve used. The paid version is worth having the categories.

Review Title: Remain friends when traveling or sharing expenses with groups!
Review Text: This app makes it sooo easy to split expenses when traveling or eating with multiple families or groups of friends. You name the event/expense, enter the amount paid, select who paid, and then identify who benefited from the expense (and what % or $ each person owes). As various expenses are entered, it tracks who owes whom how much and keeps a real-time overview/summary. This app helps us avoid confusion and tension (i.e., protects my friendships) as I travel with other families/friends and we pay for tours, excursions, meals, tips, etc.

Review Title: Amazing app which made my life so much easier
Review Text: My girl friends introduced me to that app a year ago and since then I have been using it all the time. It is so easy, efficient,  detailed and reliable. It let you split expenses in between your entire group or selected people in your hero up. You can switch currencies as well, very nice while traveling abroad. Thank you Splid for making my life so much easier. Sharing expenses is really easy thanks to you

Review Title: Very Useful and Easy to Useüëç
Review Text: This was the perfect tool for a group of 9 to split up the cost of a group trip. Everyone was onboard and the expenses were made very transparent to all! I like how in the end the least amount of transactions is produced. At first I didn‚Äôt realize what exactly was happening with all the different ‚Äúsuggested payments‚Äù but then it became clear the software was eliminating redundant sending of money around. I highly recommend this app!

Have only used once so far, and specifically for a group trip, but brilliant on all aspects!  Four different people, but with multiple expense entries that were only for two or three people (as well as majority for all four).  Also, some expenses were split evenly between people (whether two, three, or four), but a number had specific allocations based on dollar amounts (eg, for meals) or percentages - all of which were very easy to do.  Highly recommended.

Had tried another app that just made things so complicated that years later we still haven‚Äôt reconciled some of our expenses.
This is pure joy on a trip!!  3 friends and lots of meals and cabs and fun theater etc all made super simple by this app- SO easy to enter and setup!  And we actually enjoyed watching our totals and being able to use it as a guide to who picked up the next tab.

It took a bit of trial and error, also digging through menus, so I could have made better use of it earlier with a little more guidance. But now that I've found all the different ways to split expenses, I will definitely use Splid again. Being the one who always eats less and drinks no wine, it's great to be able to put in my specific expenses regardless of who's paying. Look for the options of division by fraction, percentage, or amount.

We travel as a group often, and thought this app would help us as the three of us each booked different parts of our trip. 

Unfortunately, this app doesn‚Äôt seem to be able to handle more than two members properly. Some of the things were split three ways, and others just two ways. The app allowed us to spilt it evenly like that.

The biggest problem is that the amount owed to other group members are not accurate - at all. In our case, the app was hundreds of dollars off for one group member. It just shows total out put, minus total input, which doesn‚Äôt quite solve the problem...

I love Splid! It makes dividing expenses easy. This app let our party of 4 get combined checks all throughout a 2 week trip. Everyone was easily able to enter the expenses they incurred, in whatever currency it happened to be in. We were able to easily indicate who owed on the expense, whether it was all or some of the party. And it was easy to settle up when it was time, as well!

Visited some friends and this helped me track our expenses. I appreciated having this app and not having to add anyone else and just being able to manage everything within the app myself. 

Using the free version, I can‚Äôt speak to the paid version but there were a few things on there I would appreciate having the functionality for.

This is great app! We used it for a girls trip. Five ladies, each paying for something for the group.  Really liked the feature of selecting how many and who was needing to pay for a particular expense. We bought wine at a winery, but one of the ladies is not a wine drinker. It was super easy to have that expense split 4 ways. I also really like the summary report that shows what everyone paid for and owes.

I traveled in Europe with my sisters for 2 1/2 weeks. We decided that I would pay for whatever, enter it into this app, and settle up at the end. So easy to use and the sisters could quickly see where the money was going. Just set it up again for another trip with just one sister. She‚Äôs new to international travel and bad at math so she‚Äôs grateful for the app, too.

Used this app for the first time on a trip with 5 people. The app made it easy to keep track of spending. I like the fact that any member of the group can input spending and not leave it the responsibility of one person. Since we were traveling internationally the conversion to dollars helped. I will definitely use this for my next trip.

Review Title: Great for a group of travelers!
Review Text: Super easy to use and settle up even for complicated cost splitting. Our group was 8 travelers arriving and departing on different days with multiple rental houses and cars and mixed activities and meals. Receipts were easily logged and assigned to different participants on the fly.  Created a clear picture of both the total expense of the trip and the final settlement amounts to bring the costs to an even balance between everyone.

Review Title: I‚Äôll never travel with friends without SPLID!
Review Text: I was always the one to tabulate and settle up manually, tracking, converting to pesos and back. The first trip I used SPLID made tracking swift and intuitive, even sometimes sharing expenses among only some of my fellows. Reconciling was finished in moments. And a lovely expense summary makes my inner bookkeeper very happy. I‚Äôll also have an easy reference for budgeting the next trip based on real historic spending habits.

I used this app to track expenses across our group on a vacation and loved its ease of use, particularly that I could enter expenses for multiple people without having them all sign up and contribute. The summary and settle up features are great. My only suggestion is that you should add a summary of total payout in addition to total spend for each person. Thx for a great app!

Just used Splid to track a trip to Italy. One couple for six weeks, two couples for five weeks, and a third couple joining us for two of those weeks made for tricky accounting. We used both our traditional spreadsheets and Splid to track expenses including exchange rates etc. Splid was faster by a factor of probably 10, easier, and more accurate than our spreadsheet.

I was introduced to this app a little over a month ago. Just used it on a trip with a friend. It was so easy to quickly manage the $$ without creating a Google sheet or Excel. I‚Äôll be sharing this with everyone I know on future outings, trips, and general needs. It‚Äôs a huge timesaver for me personally ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm usually the one running the numbers‚Äî great app.

SPLID is simply super!  It made my last ‚Äúgirls trip‚Äù so very much easier than past years.  Surprising how ‚Äúeven‚Äù we stayed throughout the week!  I think just being aware and being able to see at a glance how much each had contributed !   We just rotated who paid, put it in SPLID and forgot it!  I would say it is the best app I downloaded in 2022!  Thank you!

for our trip. The app is very intuitive, everything I wanted to do was easy to figure out. It also perfectly handled expenses in two currencies. All without needing to sign up for anything. Working offline is ideal when your trip is mostly a dead zone.

Review Title: Cracking app for splitting cost of shared drinks, meals, holidays, fuel expenses, anything really!
Review Text:
I‚Äôve gone on holiday with 2 other couples and splitting every round of drinks or restaurant bill 3 ways was a pain, as people often struggle to produce the right money (like if the bill is ¬£27 and everyone only has a ¬£20 note), and it just made paying each bill longer. With Splid we just take turns to pay the full amount, log it in the app and Splid works out who owes who what. If one person pays a large bill like car hire they might get let off the next couple of rounds of drinks. 
It‚Äôs worked really well for us and the only thing to remember is that transactions are shown in the order they‚Äôre logged. You can edit the date but not the time so if you forget to add a transaction until after the next one has been added they won‚Äôt be in the correct order on the screen.  (Being able to edit the time would be a nice app enhancement for us forgetful types).

Despite some reservation from a couple of friends, over a 2 week holiday this proved invaluable. Once everyone understood the concept and had faith in the maths (it really does do it right) in works like a dream. Particularly near the end, it helped showing who had the largest debt, thereby allowing them to pay for things. At the end the only had to settle a few pounds between us. Genius. Loved being able to change split too. Really helpful.

Fantastic for splitting bills over a longer period like a holiday. Works wonderfully and can even adapt on the go to allow for only part of the group being present for an expense. For example our group of four used this for our recent holiday in Barbados. One time myself and my partner had lunch and just added who was present and who paid and it split it just between us within the same bill without affecting the others in the group. Brilliant app!

Review Title: Superbly worked out app - free version generous
Review Text: I have used a few of these kind of apps before and this is by far the best. Great for trips with friends, anybody in the group can enter their expenditures (criss platform) and the others get a notification. It supports multiple currencies with live FX prices and has is a doddle to use. To top it all off the developer has been generous with the free version allowing nearly all the functionality, I supported it because quite frankly, he deserves it.

Review Title: Handy tool for tracking as well as splitting expenses
Review Text: We downloaded the free version of Splid to keep track of expenses on a recent holiday with extended family and have been really impressed with it. Simple and easy to use, easy to keep track of what was spent and on what, and easy to keep track of who owes what overall. The option to download a PDF or XLS for reference was also really great. Heartily recommended, will be upgrading to the full version now for future trips...

We usually travel in large groups sometimes as many as 30+ ppl. Working out the expense incurred at end of holiday used to be a real headache and time consuming before . Splid made holiday expense so much easier as each member could input cost incurred by them direct onto the app, with all the maths done by the app. In end it tells you who owes what to the other person. 
Will definitely recommend it .

We were on holiday with friends, taking turns to pay for drinks and meals, and wanted something to keep track of ‚Äúwhose round‚Äù it was next, when transactions we‚Äôre considerably varied in size. 

Splid does this perfectly.

Easy to set up a group, easy to invite people to join, easy to add a transaction, easy to see what the ‚Äúscores‚Äù are - it‚Äôs even easy to have fun spending that money and seeing the effects.

The ability to add transactions in pounds and euros in the same group works amazingly well, as does the ability to create uneven transactions - where people may have had more or less than others.

You can even import your most embarrassing holiday photo as a header for the group!

Well recommended.
